intro: Chaenorhinum rupestre, commonly known as the rock snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to red, bloom in late spring to early summer. Chaenorhinum rupestre is often used in rock gardens due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
